paper.title: Pre-publication revisions of bank financial statements: A novel way to monitor banks?
paper.abstract: We investigate whether pre-publication revisions of bank financial statements contain forward-looking information about bank risk. Using 7.4 million observations of monthly financial reports from all banks in Brazil during 2007-2019, we show that 78 % of all revisions occur before the publication of these statements. The frequency, missing of reporting deadlines, and severity of revisions are positively related to future bank risk. Using machine learning techniques, we provide evidence on mechanisms through which revisions affect bank risk. Our findings suggest that private information about pre-publication revisions is useful for supervisors to monitor banks.

domain_result.justification: 该论文研究了银行财务报表的预发布修订如何包含关于银行风险的未来信息，并使用机器学习技术分析修订对银行风险的影响机制，这直接涉及金融风险管理领域。
